body.p: Blood is a liquid connective tissue. Connective tissues are defined as tissues with multiple cell types and a large extracellular matrix component. The blood cells, described above, serve different functions and the plasma acts as the extracellular matrix. Blood is a unique, complex fluid with various physical characteristics and functions needed to maintain a stable internal environment in the body. Blood volume is the combination of hematocrit (45 percent) and plasma volume (55 percent). Hematocrit (hct) is the fraction of blood that is composed of red blood cells (RBCs). Besides RBC, leukocytes (white cells) and platelets make up the rest of the formed elements. The process of producing blood cells is called hematopoiesis. Stem cells are nascent cells in the bone marrow that differentiate into various types of formed elements in blood.
